intro: Boscia matabelensis, commonly known as the red bush willow, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by orange or red, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Boscia matabelensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
